title: American_Top_40_1971_October_16th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There's a singer in the countdown who used to teach karate to the LA police department and joined the Marines at age 13.

Paul Stookie, at number 24, was one third of Peter, Paul, and Mary.

Okay, either Casey didn't say anything interesting, or I was busy milti-tasking and didn't pay much attention. So, a prize of five dollars will be awarded to the person who can put something in the comment section that was interesting about this countdown, other than the music was good, which it was. 

40: Long Ago And Far Away - James Taylor
39: Natural Man - Lou Rawls
38: Macarthur Park (Part 2) - Four Tops
37: Woman's Love Rights - Laura Lee
36: You've Got To Craw; Before You Walk - The Eighth Day
35: Inner City Blues Make Me Wanna Holler - Marvin Gaye

33: The Story In Your Eyes - The Moody Blues
32: One Fine Morning - Lighthouse
31: Easy Lovin' - Freddie Hart
30: The Love We Had Stays On My Mind - The Dells
29: Make It Funky (Part 1) - James Brown
28: Birds Of A Feather - The Raiders
27: Loving Her Was Easier Than Anything I'll Ever Do Again - Kris Kristofferson
26: Never My Love - 5th Dimension
25: Stagger Lee - Tommy Roe
24: Wedding Song (There Is Love) - Paul Stookie
23: Rain Dance - The Guess Who
22: Chirpie Chirpie Cheep Cheep - Mac And Katie Kissoon

16: Trapped By A Thing Called Love - Denise Lasalle
15: I've Found Someone Of My Own - Free Movement
EXTRA: Every Picture Tells A Story - Rod Stewart
SPECIAL: Don't Be Cruel - Elvis Presley
14: So Far Away - Carole King
13: Tired Of Being Alone - Al Green
12: Smiling Faces Sometimes - Undisputed Truth
11: Gypsies, Tramps & Thieves - Cher
